remarks: Lemma for ~ lgsquad .  Count the members of ` S ` with even coordinates, and combine with ~ lgsquadlem1 to get the total count of lattice points in ` S ` (up to parity).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jun-2015.)
statement:
lgseisen.1 $e |- ( ph -> P e. ( Prime \ { 2 } ) ) $.
lgseisen.2 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. ( Prime \ { 2 } ) ) $.
lgseisen.3 $e |- ( ph -> P =/= Q ) $.
lgsquad.4 $e |- M = ( ( P - 1 ) / 2 ) $.
lgsquad.5 $e |- N = ( ( Q - 1 ) / 2 ) $.
lgsquad.6 $e |- S = { <. x , y >. | ( ( x e. ( 1 ... M ) /\ y e. ( 1 ... N ) ) /\ ( y x. P ) < ( x x. Q ) ) } $.
lgsquadlem2 $p |- ( ph -> ( Q /L P ) = ( -u 1 ^ ( # ` S ) ) ) $.
$d M x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d Q x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d ph x y $.
